stream_context.summary: Kaze models and scripts the overworld island: experimenting with sand-to-grass textures, shoreline foam animation, interactive coconuts, and bunny-print path to a cave while debugging Fast64 export issues, audio glitches, and optimization questions raised by chat.

development_findings.summary: Overworld modelling pass: new sand/grass palettes, rock props, raised dunes, and a foot-print path leading to the Bunny Brushwoods cave; current target is 20-30 stars in the hub.
Planned interactive coconuts on palm trees that fall, break, and release 0–5 coins; may also be used to wake a sleeping NPC.
development_findings.quote: All the coconut trees have coconuts… you can kick them to make them drop the coconuts that may have 0 to 5 coins in them.

development_findings.summary: Attempted shoreline foam uses a transparent decal layer that scrolls up/down with the water. Issues: Fast64 export resets random flags and decals mis-align; looking into multi-texture or abandoning foam if performance/visuals stay poor.
development_findings.quote: Seeing this, I don't believe in it anymore… we might have to just say no sand foam.

development_findings.summary: Custom linked-list render graph now stores back-links in a hash map so links don’t sit in data cache except on level load, improving performance.
development_findings.quote: The links do not set up data cache unless you're specifically looking for them… see me smart.

development_findings.summary: Waiting on Sauraen’s legacy-vertex-pipeline patch to enable Fresnel shading and packed geometry normals; current build can’t test those features.
development_findings.quote: Sauraen is working on a version of the legacy vertex pipeline that enables Fresnel like a flag is set.

development_findings.summary: Audio: switched to a different plugin to fix a bug that made music sound terrible; audio engine still imperfect, causing crackle during stream.
development_findings.quote: Fun fact, I had to change the audio plugin because there was a bug in the old audio plugin that made the music sound terrible.

development_findings.summary: Demonstrated that marking tables 'const' removes two memory loads & four MIPS instructions, rebutting chat’s claim it never affects optimization; link-time optimization is off because Mario 64 build breaks with LTO.
development_findings.quote: Look at this… const removed two memory reads and four instructions. Point proven.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 exporter currently corrupts random mode and vertex colors, producing bugs Kaze can only work around for now.
development_findings.quote: That's a Fast64 bug. Nothing I can do about it right now.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prides himself on optimization debates and welcomes correction but insists on evidence; enjoys proving points live.
context_findings.quote: Not only have I said that, I specifically noticed it optimizing something… I've also proved it.

context_findings.summary: Extremely frugal: still uses a 10-year-old Galaxy S6 and hates spending €100-200 on a phone.
context_findings.quote: I have no idea what phone I'm getting, but it can’t be worse than my dusty-ass Samsung Galaxy S6.

context_findings.summary: Fitness hobby: benches 315 lbs and views 225 lbs as a ‘noble goal for every man’.
context_findings.quote: Going for 225, I think that's a noble goal that every man should do.

context_findings.summary: Keeps aquarium fish, guppies and shrimp, dreams of elaborate indoor pools.
context_findings.quote: You guys know what I love? I love keeping fishes… it's the coolest thing ever.

context_findings.summary: Avoided looking at Nintendo’s Giga-Leak for legal reasons, reflecting caution around IP owners.
context_findings.quote: I did kind of want to look at it because that is hella views, but because of the legal implications, no.

biobak.summary: Provided visual feedback on shoreline foam, sand color, and grass; will polish graphics once Kaze delivers a working base.
biobak.quote: I'm just getting something semi decent going so when Biobak starts working on this, he has a good starting point.

badub.summary: Composed new overworld and Course 1 tracks using mostly SM64 instruments; community already streams his WIPs on SoundCloud.
badub.quote: A bunch of people are listening to Badub songs that are not even in a finished game yet—it's pretty cool.

zeina.summary: Created and supplied the bunny-footprint texture sheet during the stream.
zeina.quote: Looks good, Zeina. I will try that in a bit.

zeina.summary: Participates casually in chat, names their child ‘Debooba’, highlighting family atmosphere.

key_stories.title: The ‘const’ Showdown
key_stories.summary: Chat insisted the ‘const’ keyword never speeds up code. Kaze paused level work, modified tables live, re-built, and showed the MIPS diff, eliminating loads and instructions.
key_stories.challenge: Prove that adding ‘const’ can generate faster assembly.
key_stories.process: Removed const, compiled, measured 0x32EC size; re-added const, size shrank and loads vanished; displayed assembly.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze vindicated, chat conceded; reinforced his optimization ethos.
key_stories.key_quote: I prove to you that this removes two memory reads and four instructions—point proven.

key_stories.title: Shoreline Foam Experiment
key_stories.summary: Kaze tries to mimic gentle surf with a scrolling decal but Fast64 resets flags and the effect misaligns.
key_stories.challenge: Create convincing foam without blowing texture or CPU budget.
key_stories.process: Tested wave_height, 60 FPS draw layer, experimented with multi-texture, considered abandoning feature.
key_stories.outcome: Unresolved; may drop foam or wait for tooling fixes.
key_stories.key_quote: Seeing this, I don't believe in it anymore—we might have to just say no sand foam.

key_stories.title: Music Overhaul & Audio Bugs
key_stories.summary: Badub delivers orchestral overworld theme replacing DuckTales-style temp track. Stream audio plugin ruins first impression, triggering mixed chat reaction.
key_stories.challenge: Integrate new song without audio distortion.
key_stories.process: Switched audio plugin; previewed track; discussed layering idea abandoned for scope.
key_stories.outcome: Song accepted but engine still crackles; audio polish remains open task.
key_stories.key_quote: Do not get attached to something that is unfinished.

key_stories.title: Fast64 Export Regression
key_stories.summary: Latest Fast64 exporter fixes one issue but breaks random mode, vertex colors, and overworld rendering.
key_stories.challenge: Continue level design despite constant exporter regressions.
key_stories.process: Identified bugs, blamed random seed handling, showcased miscolored geometry.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze logs bugs, resumes work; depends on tool maintainers for fix.
key_stories.key_quote: That's a Fast64 bug—nothing I can do about it right now.

open_questions.context: Kaze says the hub will ‘change throughout the game’ with objects like flowers blooming and treasure washing up.
questions: What specific states or events will alter the overworld?
How does this tie into narrative or star progression?
Which team member owns the scripting and assets for each phase?

open_questions.context: Need Fresnel and packed normals; waiting on Sauraen’s code.
questions: What is the status and timeline of Sauraen’s patch?
How will these features change the game’s visual style?
Are there fallback plans if it’s delayed?
Can the build system be modernised to allow LTO?
How does the team coordinate with Fast64 maintainers?
What contingency exists if tooling remains buggy near release?

open_questions.context: Idea drafted during stream but not specced.
questions: Will coconuts use physics or scripted paths?
How will the mechanic be introduced to players?

open_questions.context: Kaze avoids Giga-Leak; project is an IP-heavy ROM-hack.
questions: What legal safeguards are in place for release?
Has Nintendo contacted the team before?
Would they consider an original engine port if pressured?

open_questions.context: Kaze builds ‘starting point’ before Biobak polishes.
questions: What is the pipeline from grey-box to final art?
How do they track tasks between code and art?
How does Zeina’s animation integrate with Badub’s music timing?
